update.description:
This is my contribution to gazebo_models, for adding moon surface model:

* height map is taken from http://wms.lroc.asu.edu/lroc/view_rdr_product/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036
* As for visual texture map, I cropped image from http://www.hq.nasa.gov/alsj/a17/AS17-134-20508HR.jpg, but if someone knows better data, let me know
* As for depth(height) scaling, I could not find any data, so I just manually adjust them, just to look better.
* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=dem, nasa site provides us .TIF or .IMG, and I'm not sure on relationship between DEM and IMG

![apollo_15_landing_site.jpg](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1058455158-apollo_15_landing_site.jpg)
update.title: add apollo15_landing_site_1000x*

content.raw: mmm I have not worked with this type of terrain data before so unfortunately I don't know how to interpret it.
content.html: mmm I have not worked with this type of terrain data before so unfortunately I don't know how to interpret it.

content.raw:
@iche033, thanks for explanation, I also want to know if you or people in osrf know someone familiar with ASU or NASA people who know about how to interpret 
http://wms.lroc.asu.edu/lroc/view_rdr_product/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036 data
content.html: @iche033, thanks for explanation, I also want to know if you or people in osrf know someone familiar with ASU or NASA people who know about how to interpret http://wms.lroc.asu.edu/lroc/view_rdr_product/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036 data

content.raw: I confirmed that this hack above isn't necessary with gzweb 1.2.0.
content.html: I confirmed that this hack above isn't necessary with gzweb 1.2.0.
gzweb issue fixed in pull request 75

content.raw:
The input heightmap image in `<uri>` is grayscale so the pixel values are between 0-255. The `<size>` element of the heightmap tells you the min/max height. 

So for example, if you have the `<pos>` at `0 0 0` and a `<size>` of `5 5 10` then the min and max height would be 0 and 10m. Note that the min value does not mean the bottom of the 3D terrain created but the minimum height of the terrain surface

More information on the heightmap sdf element: http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=geometry
content.html:
The input heightmap image in <uri> is grayscale so the pixel values are between 0-255. The <size> element of the heightmap tells you the min/max height.

So for example, if you have the <pos> at 0 0 0 and a <size> of 5 5 10 then the min and max height would be 0 and 10m. Note that the min value does not mean the bottom of the 3D terrain created but the minimum height of the terrain surface

More information on the heightmap sdf element: http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.5&elem=geometry

@iche033, there are several things that I'm not sure on this PR, I know that OSRF is working with NASA people, so if you know someone who have knowledge on followings, please let me know. - where can in find information on min/max height of the hightmap data, currently it seems the data is normalized between 0 - 255 - I took (visual) texture image from nasa archive, but if you know better one I'd like to know.

content.raw:
Thanks for the contribution. If it's works on gzclient but not gzweb then it's likely a bug in gzweb. 

I'll take a look at it soon. This pull request looks good with one texture in the heightmap model.
content.html:
Thanks for the contribution. If it's works on gzclient but not gzweb then it's likely a bug in gzweb.

I'll take a look at it soon. This pull request looks good with one texture in the heightmap model.

content.raw:
I also try to use this model on gzweb but it turns out that we need to add following changes, is there any limitation that we have to have 3 textures ??? I'm using gzweb 1.1.0 and gazebo 2.2.3 on indigo/trusty

```
#!c++

k-okada@kokada-t440s:~/catkin_ws/ws_tork/src/gazebo_models$ hg diff
diff -r 3c81a9c40e79 apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf
--- a/apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf	Sat Jan 03 23:40:08 2015 +0900
+++ b/apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf	Sun Jan 04 03:53:40 2015 +0900
@@ -17,10 +17,28 @@
         <geometry>
           <heightmap>
             <texture>
+              <diffuse>file://media/materials/textures/dirt_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
+              <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
+              <size>5</size>
+            </texture>
+            <texture>
+              <diffuse>file://media/materials/textures/grass_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
+              <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
+              <size>5</size>
+            </texture>
+            <texture>
               <diffuse>file://apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/materials/textures/AS17-134-20508HR_1024x1024_1.jpg</diffuse>
               <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
-              <size>3</size>
+              <size>20</size>
             </texture>
+            <blend>
+              <min_height>-150</min_height>
+              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
+            </blend>
+            <blend>
+              <min_height>-100</min_height>
+              <fade_dist>10</fade_dist>
+            </blend>
             <uri>model://apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/materials/textures/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036_2000x2000+611+5682.png</uri>
             <size>1000 1000 80</size>
             <pos>0 0 -77</pos>

```
content.html:
I also try to use this model on gzweb but it turns out that we need to add following changes, is there any limitation that we have to have 3 textures ??? I'm using gzweb 1.1.0 and gazebo 2.2.3 on indigo/trusty

k-okada@kokada-t440s:~/catkin_ws/ws_tork/src/gazebo_models$ hg diff
diff -r 3c81a9c40e79 apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf
--- a/apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf Sat Jan 03 23:40:08 2015 +0900
+++ b/apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/model-1_4.sdf Sun Jan 04 03:53:40 2015 +0900
@@ -17,10 +17,28 @@
         <geometry>
           <heightmap>
             <texture>
+              <diffuse>file://media/materials/textures/dirt_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
+              <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
+              <size>5</size>
+            </texture>
+            <texture>
+              <diffuse>file://media/materials/textures/grass_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
+              <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
+              <size>5</size>
+            </texture>
+            <texture>
               <diffuse>file://apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/materials/textures/AS17-134-20508HR_1024x1024_1.jpg</diffuse>
               <normal>file://media/materials/textures/flat_normal.png</normal>
-              <size>3</size>
+              <size>20</size>
             </texture>
+            <blend>
+              <min_height>-150</min_height>
+              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
+            </blend>
+            <blend>
+              <min_height>-100</min_height>
+              <fade_dist>10</fade_dist>
+            </blend>
             <uri>model://apollo15_landing_site_1000x1000/materials/textures/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036_2000x2000+611+5682.png</uri>
             <size>1000 1000 80</size>
             <pos>0 0 -77</pos>

* height map is taken from http://wms.lroc.asu.edu/lroc/view_rdr_product/NAC_DTM_APOLLO15_E261N0036
* As for visual texture map, I cropped image from http://www.hq.nasa.gov/alsj/a17/AS17-134-20508HR.jpg, but if someone knows better data, let me know
